title: How much damage did Joseph McCarthy do to the Democratic Party? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: McCarthy’s targets were Eisenhower Administration agencies — Department of the Army, Department of State, for example. Nevertheless, Eisenhower was reelected, despite whatever influence McCarthy might have had. The point is that McCarthy had not done much damage at all to any party. Nixon’s early years had a similar anti-Communist flavor. Ike had come close to dumping Nixon, just as the McCarthy era was coming to a close. If McCarthy’s extreme anti-Communism had won wide spread support, Nixon’s anti-Communism would have produced overwhelming advantage in his campaign for the presidency. It didn’t. Democrat John F. Kennedy won the presidency in 1960, demonstrating McCarthy didn’t damage the Democratic Party to such an extent that it was no longer viable.
Joseph McCarthy was a Republican senator from Wisconsin. Far from doing long-term damage to the Democratic Party, his recklessness and unsubstantiated accusations damaged the Republican Party.
